extendedIngredients.name: chili
extendedIngredients.originalString: 32 ounces of your favorite no-bean chili

extendedIngredients.name: onions
extendedIngredients.originalString: Chopped onions and sliced jalapeños, as garnish (if desired)

recipes.title: Frito Pie Dogs – Southwest Love on a Bun

winePairing.pairingText: Hot Dogs can be paired with Riesling, Gewurztraminer, and rosé Wine. A Gewürztraminer will be great with your basic New York style hot dog with mustard and sauerkraut. For a Chicago-style dog with sour pickles and hot peppers, you might opt for a crisp Riesling. No matter your toppings, a dry rosé almost always works. The Engel Wines Riesling - Kosher with a 5 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 20 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Engel Wines Riesling - Kosher
productMatches.description: A lively off-dry Riesling, with accents of green apple, citrus and tropical fruits, complemented by delicate floral aromas, and a crisp acidity. Enjoy this wine chilled.

recipes.instructions: Cook hot dogs and heat chili.  Place about 1/4 cup of corn chips on hot dog bun. Add cooked franks. pour over about 2 Tablespoons chili. top with cheese, onions and jalapeños.Serve immediately with a good cold beer or soda.Share and enjoy!

steps.step: Cook hot dogs and heat chili.
Place about 1/4 cup of corn chips on hot dog bun.
Add cooked franks. pour over about 2 Tablespoons chili. top with cheese, onions and jalapeños.
Serve immediately with a good cold beer or soda.Share and enjoy!
